All the weekend national, UK-wide and international news on Saturday evening at 7.
Steven Thompson presents highlights from the day's games in the Scottish Premiership, including Dundee v Hibernian, Falkirk v Kilmarnock, Hearts v Aberdeen and Livingston v St Mirren.
1/6. A look at Frank McAvennie's football career, featuring contributions from Bill McMurdo, Tony Cottee, Bianca Westwood, Mick McCarthy and Alan Rough.
1/2. Documentary taking a humorous look at the early days of tourism in Scotland, from the Speyside St Moritz to cultural Clydeside.

programmes.show_name: Murder Case: The Hunt for Arlene Fraser's Killer
programmes.show_description: 1/2. Elgin, 1998. Police begin to piece together clues when a mother vanishes from her home. Contains some strong language and some upsetting scenes.
12/16. Hue and Cry, Alasdair Beckett-King, Alana Jackson and The Laurettes join Michelle in the studio, with music from the archives from BRIT Critics' Choice winner Jacob Alon.
Some of the best bits from the comedy sketch show. Contains adult humour.

All the weekend national, UK-wide and international news on Sunday evening at 7.
Extended highlights of Rangers v Celtic as two of the Scottish Premiership heavyweights go head-to-head.

programmes.show_name: The Repair Shop on the Road
programmes.show_description: Will and Dom learn how a devastating fire put a 5,000-year-old craft in jeopardy. Meanwhile, Chris Shaw repairs a Gaelic pipe music book, and Dom has the chance to make his own sporran.
3/10. Paramedics help a woman who has been thrown off a horse near Dunbar. Meanwhile, the air ambulance brings a child with appendicitis from Campbeltown to Glasgow.
Sitcom. Jack and Victor become dogsitters, and Winston's jealousy sparks some serious pet one-upmanship. Isa prepares for the Craiglang Community Bake Off. Contains adult humour.
1/5. Scotland's favourite force are back battling bams and busting scams. The Chief deals with speculation he might quit his tartan patch to become head of the London Met.
2/8. Christine opens up to Sophie about dating with autism. Contains some strong language and adult humour.
Gary Robertson brings you all the main issues from the world of politics and beyond. Big interviews, discussion and analysis of the stories that matter to Scotland.
